passages.text: In the summer of 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the Moon. His famous words, transmitted back to Earth, declared it one small step for man and one giant leap for mankind. The Apollo 11 mission represented years of dedication, scientific advancement, and the collective dreams of millions who looked toward the stars.

The ancient Library of Alexandria was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world. It was dedicated to the Muses, the nine goddesses of the arts, and functioned as a major center of scholarship. Scholars estimate it may have held anywhere from 40,000 to 400,000 scrolls at its height.

Coffee is one of the most popular beverages in the world. It is made from roasted coffee beans, which are the seeds of berries from the Coffea plant. The two most commonly grown types are Arabica and Robusta. Coffee cultivation and trade began on the Arabian Peninsula and has since spread globally.
